intro: Jasione amethystina var. longidentata, commonly known as the long-toothed jasione, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, pinkish-purple flowers. The leaves are lance-shaped with prominent teeth, giving it its common name. It typically grows in dry, sunny grasslands and rocky areas. This variety is noted for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in gardens for its delicate appearance.
